intro: Urceolina cyaneosperma, commonly known as the blue-seed urceolina, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking blue seeds, which are enclosed in a distinctive, urn-shaped capsule. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. Urceolina cyaneosperma is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical environments.
